about First Commercial
----------------------

The First Commercial Family of Companies is a specialized group of vertically integrated boutique firms, focusing on multifamily and investment properties in Tulsa and surrounding areas. We are able to support our Client’s needs from pre-acquisition through ownership and eventual sale.  

As specialists, our knowledge and experience allows us to provide a high level of service to our Clients. Our focus is to build lasting relationships and long term Clients who reap the rewards of our expertise. Please give us a call and find out the benefits of being a First Commercial Client.

![Connie Hardaway](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/connie-hardaway.png)

Connie Hardaway

__________

My experience with First Commercial was fast and easy. I was surprised how management was so professional with assisting me ,and how fast the responses I received. I refer First Commercial Multifamily Management Company to everyone looking for a place to call home.

![Megan Thomas](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/megan-thomas.png)

Megan Thomas

__________

Love the people at First Commercial and have loved my new place. Any issues I’ve had, have been resolved promptly and with quick communication - priceless!

![Gavin Robinson](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/03/gavin.png)

Gavin Robinson

__________

First Commercial has been the best property management team I’ve worked with in all of my years of renting. They’re responsive, transparent, and work with you from the get go. Highly recommend.

our history
-----------

President and CEO Richard Sudduth founded his first company, Commercial Property Research Corporation, in 1988. It provided information and analytics on every multifamily property in the Tulsa MSA. Since then, Mr. Sudduth has grown his company to include Brokerage and Management of apartments, HOA’s and single family investment properties.

data.markdown:
[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/about-us/#main)

About First Commercial Companies:
---------------------------------

The First Commercial Companies include Brokerage and Management services that focus on helping multifamily investors. First Commercial has focused exclusively on multifamily for more than 25 years, giving us unparalleled knowledge and experience in the Oklahoma market. Our vertically integrated companies mean our Clients have a team of professionals guiding them from pre-acquisition through ownership and management and eventual sale.

About First Commercial Real Estate Services
-------------------------------------------

First Commercial Real Estate Services is a brokerage and consulting firm that specializes in the sale of multifamily properties and development land in Oklahoma.

As specialists, our knowledge and experience allows us to provide a high level of service to our Clients. Our focus is to build lasting relationships and long term Clients who reap the rewards of our expertise. Please give us a call and find out the benefits of being a First Commercial Client.

FCRE Services:

*   Asset Management
*   Receivership Services
*   Consultant Services
*   Brokerage Services
*   Site Selection
*   Site Analysis
*   Property Feasibility Studies
*   Leasing Analysis
*   Property Management Analysis
*   Brokers Opinion of Value (BOV)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/shape-01.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/pen-in-the-hands.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/shape-02.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/hand-shake.png)

About First Commercial Multifamily Management Services:
-------------------------------------------------------

First Commercial Multifamily Management Services (FCMM) provides Clients with a cost effective, professional solution to managing investment properties in the Tulsa area. The company was founded in 2013 and has managed apartment communities of all sizes in Tulsa, Broken Arrow, Bixby, Glenpool, Sand Springs, Sapulpa, Jenks and Owasso. Thanks to decades of multifamily brokerage experience, along with an in-house CPA and innovative property management software, FCMM successfully meets our Clients’ needs while ensuring residents have the best possible home.

FCMM Services:

*   Negotiate Leases
*   Provide Planning & Budgeting
*   Maintain Property Appearance
*   Provide Advertising & Cross Marketing
*   Resident Screening
*   Provide Monthly Reporting

ABOUT FIRST COMMERCIAL HOA management:
--------------------------------------

First Commercial Multifamily Association and Unit Management is pleased to offer management services for Home Owner’s Associations, Condos, Single Family Homes and Duplexes. It is our belief that a property should be maintained in the best condition possible within a set budget. For HOAs, we provide monthly reports, as well as access to an Association Portal which provides a real-time look at the full accounting systems, bank balances, work orders and budgets.

Our licensed property managers provide resident screening, marketing, maintenance, reporting and accounting.

*   Negotiate Leases
*   Provide Planning & Budgeting
*   Maintain Property Appearance
*   Provide Advertising & Cross Marketing
*   Resident Screening
*   Provide Monthly Reporting

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/shape-01.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/pen-in-the-hands.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/shape-02.png)

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/hand-shake.png)

About First Commercial referral Services:
-----------------------------------------

Why take your valuable time learning the multifamily market, properties, financial analysis, property inspections, condition, financing, and the unique negotiating skills specific to multifamily acquisitions or dispositions? Let us do the work and utilize over 30 years of multifamily experience to provide you with additional revenue.

We have established relationships with:

*   Property Management Companies
*   Banks
*   National Lenders
*   Insurance Companies
*   Appraisers
*   Title Companies

[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/management-services/#main)

Multifamily Management
----------------------

First Commercial Multifamily Management prides itself in communication with Owners. One of the many benefits you will enjoy is having an asset manager assigned to your property. Your asset manager will review reports monthly, as will our on-staff CPA. 

We provide quarterly inspections of all units to the condition is being maintained as well as to ensure ensure smoke detectors are operational and filters are changed.   
  

As a management company, our biggest focus is on increasing NOI. We have an impressive history of  increasing rents and finding ways to creatively add to the income of a property.

**By providing exceptional service to our Owners, we:**

*   Maximize NOI
*   Negotiate Leases
*   Provide Planning and Budgeting
*   Maintain Property Appearance
*   Provide Advertising and Cross Marketing
*   Utilize Resident Screening
*   Focus on Resident Retention
*   Provide Monthly Reporting: Via Email or Online
*   Encourage Direct Deposit / 24-hour payments
*   Leasing by Professional Brokers
*   Perform Preventative Maintenance

**Please call for consultation: [(918) 921-1677](tel:9189211677)
**

data.markdown:
[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/apartment-management/#main)

APARTMENT MANAGEMENT
--------------------

First Commercial Multifamily Management Services (FCMM) provides Clients with a cost effective, professional solution to managing investment properties in the Tulsa area. 

The company was founded in 2013 and has managed apartment communities of all sizes in Tulsa, Broken Arrow, Bixby, Glenpool, Sand Springs, Sapulpa, Jenks and Owasso. Thanks to decades of multifamily brokerage experience, along with an in-house CPA and innovative property management software, FCMM successfully meets our Clients’ needs while ensuring residents have the best possible home.

[Contact Us](mailto:info@first-commercial.com)

Our Mission

*   Provide professional property and asset management services
*   Maximize the value of Clients’ assets
*   Assist Owners in achieving investment objectives
*   Provide services with honesty and integrity
*   Give accurate and timely accounting and reporting

### “My clients owned two small apartment complexes and were getting frustrated with their management company’s lack of communication and services. I referred them to First Commercial, and they were completely satisfied with the partnership, allowing my clients to turn their attention back to their day jobs. The professionalism and attention to detail is the primary reason I do not hesitate to refer any property owner to First Commercial for both management services and broker services.“  
–Brian Talkington, First National Bank and Trust of Broken Arrow

WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT?
------------------------

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/users-icon.png)

### A Dedicated Team

First Commercial networks and employs professional suppliers and service providers to care for all properties under our management.

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/stats-icon.png)

### Innovative Software

First Commercial uses the AppFolio software system, which allows us to advertise vacancies across multiple platforms, screen for quality residents and collect rent online.

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/property_managment.png)

### Asset Management

Your financials are reviewed by an Asset Manager/Licensed Broker to ensure the best financial health of your property. We watch the market and advise Owners according to their investment goals.

Looking for a management partner?

[Request a Proposal](mailto:rap@first-commercial.com)

[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/hoa-management/#main)

Association management
----------------------

First Commercial is pleased to offer [management services in Tulsa](https://www.fcasok.com/)
 for Home Owner’s Associations, Condos, Single Family Homes and Duplexes. It is our belief that a property should be maintained in the best condition possible within a set budget. For HOAs, we provide monthly reports, as well as access to an Association Portal which provides a real-time look at the full accounting systems, bank balances, work orders and budgets.

When you choose First Commercial to manage your Association, you not only get a qualified team of licensed property managers, you also get the benefit of a company with over 30 years of multifamily experience. In addition to Association Management, Owners can choose management of their unit at a discounted rate which includes leasing, marketing and  maintenance.

[Contact Us](mailto:ginas@first-commercial.com)

We Offer:

*   Online dues payments
*   Customized HOA accounting
*   Board member reporting
*   Online maintenance & mobile inspections
*   Online work orders
*   After hours emergency maintenance line
*   One team covers team of management, maintenance and accounting
*   Customized property website

First Commercial Association Management has a team of professionals on the payroll, allowing us to offer services like construction management for renovations and unit management and leasing at 50% of the current market rate. We also build and maintain professional property websites used to communicate clearly and quickly important information. 

### “I have been absolutely thrilled to have First Commercial as our Property Management at Willow Creek III. Richard and Gina and all of the staff listen and care and  take action. You see them on the property almost daily making sure everything is being improved and maintained. The overall improvement of our property has been astounding since First Commercial came on board. First Commercial takes pride in the Properties they oversee and they instill that sense of pride in the Property Owners.“

WHAT MAKES US DIFFERENT?
------------------------

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/user-world-icon.png)

### On Demand  
Statement Access

Owner and Association statements are securely posted to an online Association Board or Owners Portal. We can also include maintenance invoices and additional reports you request.

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/bov.png)

### Prompt Maintenance  
Resolution

We use electronic work - orders and communication with vendors so we can quickly resolve issues. We can email a copy of the work order and relevant information giving you real - time updates.

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/brokerage_services.png)

### Efficient Dues  
Collections

Modern residents expect easy, online payment options. We give residents the option of paying with ACH/auto draft.

Looking for a management partner?

[Request a Proposal](mailto:rfp@first-commercial.com)

data.markdown:
[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/board-services/#main)

BOARD SERVICES
--------------

The management of an HOA is unique.  The Ownership has the right to vote in the decision making process but rarely, if ever, is there a quorum met to make these decisions as a whole.  That means the decision making is left to the Board of Administrators.  That is a heavy burden for a group of 4-7 people to carry.  

It is the opinion of FCMM that partnering with professional management can lead to a prosperous and well maintained neighborhood.  FCMM will work with the Board to make informed, researched, and well planned decisions that fit within the long term goals and budget of the community.

FCMM provides the accounting procedures, qualified personnel and cutting edge technology which allows accurate accounting and reporting on a regularly scheduled basis and provides the Owner’s or Association’s CPA or accountants with all the necessary reports and documentation to complete timely annual tax returns and reports to the Owners and Investors.

While FCMM is a profit based company, we do not feel that  tacking on excessive fees is the way to do business. Therefore, we do not up-charge any of our services and do not tack on any additional fees, such as trip charges, etc.

All of our charges are clearly identified before a contract is signed. FCMM does not own any part of the third-party contractors that we use nor do we receive any “kick-backs”, commissions or incentive fees for using these companies. 

We attach all invoices to work orders so the Client sees exactly what the expenses are.  We pay all bills weekly, , making reports very consistent and as true to monthly costs as possible. We provide full financial reports to the Owners or Associations every month and a summary page that breaks down the month financially.  We also provide a monthly management report that identifies all of the activities performed on the property by our management and maintenance staff, as well as recommendations for going forward. 

*   Board meeting notifications
*   Preparation of board meeting agendas
*   Proprietary board meeting software
*   CPA on staff

*   Preparation of board minutes and motion sheets
*   Board member documents provided online
*   Construction management for renovations
*   Board room for Association use

Home & condo management
-----------------------

First Commercial offers professional management and leasing services to Owners of condo units and single family investment properties. 

Your investment will be in good hands with our licensed real estate property managers. We will handle the marketing of your unit or single family home and then run comprehensive credit and background screenings on qualified applicants.  We address all maintenance issues in a timely manner, day or night, and you will be kept up to date with monthly reports.

Our Management & Leasing Services Include:

*   Screen Residents
*   Negotiate Leases
*   Professional Photography & Marketing
*   Monthly Reporting

*   Rent Collection
*   24 Hour Maintenance
*   Quarterly Pest Control
*   Quarterly Property Inspections

Why First Commercial?
---------------------

Why take your valuable time learning the multifamily market, properties, financial analysis, property inspections, condition, financing, and the unique negotiating skills specific to multifamily acquisitions or dispositions? Just sit back, let us do the work and utilize over 30 years of our multifamily experience, to provide you with additional revenue.

It is the desire of First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation to provide services to the Brokerage Community by offering multiple options under which First Commercial will accept referrals.

[Contact Us](mailto:info@first-commercial.com)

It is our belief that full disclosure, superior communication and service between the parties can build lasting relationships. We encourage and embrace referrals from the brokerage community and want to work with other companies and brokers while providing the highest quality of service for the benefit of their Clients and Customers. We specialize in all types of multifamily properties and therefore have the knowledge, experience, contacts, negotiating skills and processes to best assist a Client with their multifamily needs.

![](https://first-commercial.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/10/reffreal_bg.jpg)

data.markdown:
[Skip to content](https://first-commercial.com/privacy-policy/#main)

Who we are
----------

Our website address is: https://first-commercial.com.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it
---------------------------------------------------

### Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

### Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

### Contact forms

### Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select “Remember Me”, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

### Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

### Analytics

Who we share your data with
---------------------------

How long we retain your data
----------------------------

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data
-----------------------------------

How to Keep Your apartment safe during holiday travel
-----------------------------------------------------

**December 5, 2025**

The holiday season is a time for celebration, travel, and making memories, but it’s also a time when apartments can be more vulnerable to accidents or break-ins. Whether you’re heading out of town for a weekend or spending several weeks away, a little preparation goes a long way in keeping your home safe and giving you peace of mind.

At **First Commercial Real Estate & Management**, your comfort and security matter to us. Here are our top tips to help ensure your apartment stays safe while you enjoy your holiday travels

### **Double-Check Doors, Windows & Locks**

Before you leave, take a few minutes to do a walk-through:

*   Ensure all windows are fully closed and locked
    
*   Test your front-door lock and deadbolt
    
*   Remove spare keys stored outside—thieves know the common hiding spots
    
*   If you have a patio or balcony door, secure it with the provided locking bar or rod
    

A quick security sweep can eliminate many potential risks.

* * *

### **Use Smart Lighting or Timers**

A dark, quiet apartment for several days can signal that no one is home. To help your home look lived-in:

*   Set a few lamps on timers
    
*   Use smart bulbs or plugs to automate lighting
    
*   Leave blinds or curtains in their usual positions
    

Consistency is key—don’t make sudden changes right before leaving.

* * *

### **Unplug Nonessential Electronics**

Beyond security, safety matters too. Reduce fire risk and save energy by unplugging:

*   Small appliances
    
*   TVs and gaming consoles
    
*   Chargers
    
*   Holiday lights
    

This simple step helps prevent electrical hazards while you’re gone.

* * *

### **Hold Your Mail and Deliveries**

Overflowing mail or stacks of packages outside your door are clear signs you’re not home.  
Options include:

*   Placing a USPS mail hold
    
*   Using Amazon Locker or package rooms (if available at your property)
    
*   Asking a trusted neighbor to pick up deliveries
    

* * *

### **Avoid Broadcasting Your Travel Plans**

It’s tempting to share vacation photos in real time, but doing so can unintentionally alert others that your home is empty.  
Take photos—just wait to post them until you’re back.

* * *

### **Adjust Your Thermostat Responsibly**

If you’ll be gone for an extended period:

*   Set your thermostat to an energy-efficient but safe temperature
    
*   In cold climates, make sure heat stays above the minimum recommended level to prevent frozen pipes
    

* * *

### **Remove Garbage & Perishable Food**

Before leaving, clear your fridge and take out the trash. Nothing welcomes you home like… well, not bad smells.

* * *

### **Secure Valuables**

Store small valuable items—passports, jewelry, important documents—in a secure place. A small lockbox can offer extra peace of mind.

* * *

### **Rely on Your Community**

One of the best things about multifamily living is having neighbors nearby.  
Consider:

*   Letting a trusted neighbor know you’ll be gone
    
*   Asking them to report anything unusual
    

* * *

### **Enjoy Your Holiday Season with Confidence**

With a few thoughtful steps, you can head out for the holidays knowing your apartment is secure. From all of us at **First Commercial Real Estate & Management**, we hope you have a safe, warm, and joyful holiday season!

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

Why Your Small Business Needs Office Space
------------------------------------------

**October 9, 2025**

As a business owner, you might be wondering whether investing in office space is a necessary step toward growth. The answer is most likely yes. Having a dedicated office space not only enhances your professional image but also boosts productivity, fosters collaboration, and provides a centralized location for your team and clients.

**Boost Your Professional Image**  
A physical office helps establish credibility and professionalism. It shows clients and partners that your business is solid, trustworthy, and here to stay. A professional environment makes a positive impression and can help you stand out in a competitive market.

**Increase Productivity and Focus**  
Working from home or a coffee shop can be convenient, but it often comes with distractions. An office provides a dedicated area to focus solely on your business activities, leading to increased efficiency and clearer boundaries between work and personal life.

**Encourage Collaboration and Creativity**  
Having a shared space fosters teamwork, idea-sharing, and spontaneous discussions. Whether you have a small team or work solo but collaborate with others, an office environment supports innovation and collective problem-solving.

**Access to Essential Resources**  
Modern office spaces come equipped with the amenities you need to run your business smoothly, such as high-speed internet, meeting rooms, and secure facilities. This allows you to focus on your core work without worrying about administrative hassles.

**Networking and Business Growth Opportunities**  
Being part of a professional community can open doors to new partnerships, clients, and growth opportunities. Office buildings often host other entrepreneurs and small businesses, providing valuable networking prospects.

* * *

Ready to take your business to the next level? We have a range of office spaces available at First Commercial Plaza in South Tulsa. Visit [www.firstcommercialplaza.com](http://www.firstcommercialplaza.com/)
 to explore available units and imagine the endless possibilities for your business growth. Secure your professional space today and watch your business thrive!

Why More People Are Choosing to Rent—And It’s Not Who You Think
---------------------------------------------------------------

**September 29, 2025**

When most people think of renters, the image that often comes to mind is of young professionals or college students just starting out. While that demographic certainly exists, the modern rental landscape is far more diverse than you might expect. At First Commercial Real Estate & Management, we’ve seen firsthand how the choice to rent appeals to a wide variety of lifestyles and life stages.

Here’s a closer look at the surprising mix of people choosing to rent in today’s market—and why they’re doing it.

### **1\. Empty Nesters Looking to Simplify**

Many parents find themselves with a large, mostly empty home once their children move out. Rather than continuing to maintain a house that no longer suits their needs, more and more empty nesters are choosing to rent.

Renting offers the freedom to downsize and simplify. There’s no yard to maintain, no roof to replace, and no long-term commitment tying them to a specific location. It’s a smart, stress-free option that lets them enjoy this new chapter of life without being tied down.

* * *

### **2\. Downsizers Seeking a Fresh Start**

Sometimes, less really is more. Whether due to retirement, lifestyle changes, or simply a desire to cut back on space and responsibility, downsizing has become an increasingly popular trend. Renting makes this transition easier by eliminating many of the financial and maintenance burdens that come with homeownership.

Plus, today’s rental properties offer a wide range of modern amenities, making it possible to live comfortably—and stylishly—with less space.

* * *

### **3\. Travel Enthusiasts and Digital Nomads**

With remote work on the rise, a growing number of professionals are embracing a more mobile lifestyle. These travel lovers prefer the flexibility of renting so they can pick up and go without worrying about selling a house or managing a mortgage.

For digital nomads and globetrotters, renting offers the perfect balance: a comfortable place to call home when needed, with the freedom to explore the world on their own terms.

* * *

### **4\. Newly Single or Recently Divorced**

Life changes happen, and sometimes that means making a new start. For individuals going through a divorce or separation, renting offers a more flexible and less overwhelming transition. It allows them to get their bearings without the pressure of buying a new home right away.

It’s not just about necessity—it’s about creating a space that feels like their own, quickly and without long-term commitment.

* * *

### **5\. Career Movers and Temporary Relocators**

Whether it’s a job promotion, a temporary assignment, or testing the waters in a new city, many professionals find that renting is the most practical option during periods of career change. It allows them to settle into a new place quickly while maintaining the ability to adapt as needed.

This is especially true in dynamic markets like Tulsa, where people often come for short-term projects or growth opportunities.

* * *

### **6\. Investors and Savvy Savers**

Interestingly, some people who can afford to buy are choosing to rent—on purpose. Why? Because they see renting as a strategic financial move. By renting, they free up capital for investing, business ventures, or saving for something big down the road.

These renters view housing as a flexible, functional choice—not just a traditional rite of passage.

* * *

### **Renting Is for Everyone—And That’s a Good Thing**

At First Commercial Real Estate & Management, we’re proud to serve a wide range of tenants with different backgrounds, goals, and lifestyles. Renting isn’t just a stepping stone anymore—it’s a smart, flexible option that can fit just about anyone’s life.

Whether you’re downsizing, starting over, or simply prioritizing freedom and mobility, there’s a rental solution that fits your needs. And we’re here to help you find it.

* * *

**Looking for your next place to rent in Tulsa?**  
Explore our available properties or contact our team to learn more about how we can help you find the perfect fit.

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

How Professional Property Management Protects Your Investment
-------------------------------------------------------------

**September 9, 2025**

Owning property is one of the most reliable ways to build wealth—but simply holding real estate doesn’t guarantee success. The true key to long-term profitability lies in how the property is managed. Professional property management ensures that your investment isn’t just preserved, but strategically positioned to grow in value.

### 1\. Maximizing Occupancy and Rental Income

A vacant space is a missed opportunity. Property managers know how to market effectively, screen tenants, and maintain strong relationships to keep occupancy rates high. By minimizing downtime between tenants and setting competitive rental rates, management companies help owners get the most out of their investment.

### 2\. Reducing Risk and Liability

From navigating lease agreements to ensuring compliance with local, state, and federal regulations, property managers protect owners from costly legal missteps. They also handle tenant disputes, collections, and evictions professionally—reducing exposure to liability and stress.

### 3\. Protecting the Physical Asset

Your property is only as valuable as its condition. Management teams oversee regular maintenance, vendor contracts, and capital improvements, ensuring the building remains attractive and functional. This proactive approach prevents small issues from becoming expensive problems down the road.

### 4\. Financial Oversight and Transparency

Professional managers provide clear, detailed financial reporting. From rent collection to budgeting and forecasting, owners gain peace of mind knowing their investment is tracked with accuracy and accountability.

### 5\. Long-Term Asset Performance

The best management companies don’t just handle the day-to-day—they plan for the future. With market knowledge and strategic insight, they identify opportunities to increase value, whether through renovations, repositioning, or improved operations.

### Final Thoughts

Property management is more than convenience—it’s protection. A professional management partner safeguards your asset, enhances returns, and ensures your property remains competitive in a changing market. For owners, that means less worry and more confidence that their investment is working for them.

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

What Are Rent Concessions and Why Are They Beneficial?
------------------------------------------------------

**September 2, 2025**

If you’ve been searching for an apartment, you may have come across the term **“rent concession.”** But what exactly does that mean, and how can it benefit both renters and property owners?

### What Are Rent Concessions?

A **rent concession** is an incentive offered by a landlord or property management company to attract new tenants or encourage current residents to renew their lease. Concessions typically involve temporary discounts or perks that make leasing more appealing.

Common types of rent concessions include:

*   **Reduced Rent:** For example, “First month free” or “$200 off your first three months.”
    
*   **Waived Fees:** Application, parking, or amenity fees may be temporarily eliminated.
    
*   **Added Perks:** Free upgrades, gift cards, or additional amenities at no extra cost.
    

### Why Rent Concessions Are Beneficial

### For Renters:

*   **Immediate Savings:** Concessions can lower move-in costs, which is especially helpful during times when money is tight.
    
*   **Flexibility:** Short-term discounts allow renters to experience a new community without a long-term financial strain.
    
*   **Access to Better Housing:** Incentives may open the door to communities or apartments that might otherwise be out of budget.
    

### For Property Owners & Managers:

*   **Attract New Residents Quickly:** Offering a concession makes a property stand out in a competitive market.
    
*   **Reduce Vacancy Rates:** The faster units are filled, the less income is lost.
    
*   **Encourage Renewals:** A well-timed concession can help retain happy residents.
    

### Final Thoughts

Rent concessions can be a win-win: renters enjoy cost savings and perks, while property owners benefit from lower vacancies and satisfied residents. Whether it’s a discount on rent, waived fees, or a unique perk, these incentives create added value and make leasing more attractive.

If you’re in the market for a new place, keep an eye out for rent concessions—they might just help you land the perfect home at the perfect price.

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

What First-Time Multifamily Investors Should Know
-------------------------------------------------

**August 18, 2025**

Investing in multifamily properties — whether it’s a small apartment building or a larger community — can be an exciting way to grow wealth, generate steady income, and diversify your portfolio. But like any investment, it comes with its own learning curve. If you’re considering your first step into multifamily real estate, here are some key things you should know.

### 1\. Understand the Appeal of Multifamily Investments

Unlike single-family rentals, multifamily properties provide multiple streams of income under one roof. Even if one unit is vacant, the others can continue generating revenue. Multifamily properties also tend to appreciate steadily and may offer tax advantages that make them especially attractive to long-term investors.

* * *

### 2\. Financing is Different Than Single-Family

While many first-time investors are familiar with conventional home loans, multifamily properties often require different financing structures. For smaller properties (2–4 units), you may still be able to use a residential loan. Larger properties (5+ units) usually involve commercial financing, with stricter requirements for down payments, reserves, and borrower experience. It’s important to connect with a lender who specializes in multifamily lending early in the process.

* * *

### 3\. Location Matters More Than You Think

A multifamily property’s success hinges on its location. Look for areas with strong rental demand, job growth, and access to amenities like schools, retail, and transportation. A great building in the wrong neighborhood won’t perform as well as a modest property in a thriving area.

* * *

### 4\. Know Your Numbers

Successful multifamily investing is all about the math. Before making an offer, you’ll want to analyze:

*   **Net Operating Income (NOI):** Revenue minus operating expenses.
    
*   **Cap Rate:** A measure of the property’s potential return.
    
*   **Cash-on-Cash Return:** How much income you’re earning compared to the cash you invested.
    
*   **Vacancy Rates & Rent Growth:** Local market data that impacts long-term performance.
    

* * *

### 5\. Property Management Can Make or Break You

Multifamily properties require consistent oversight — from leasing and maintenance to tenant relations and compliance. Many first-time investors underestimate the time commitment. Partnering with an experienced property management company can protect your investment, keep residents satisfied, and free you up to focus on strategy instead of daily operations.

* * *

### 6\. Expect the Unexpected

Vacancies, maintenance surprises, and market shifts are part of the investment landscape. Smart investors plan ahead by setting aside reserves for repairs and turnover, ensuring they aren’t caught off guard by unexpected expenses.

* * *

### 7\. Think Long-Term

Multifamily properties are rarely a “get-rich-quick” investment. Wealth is typically built over time, through consistent cash flow, gradual rent increases, and property appreciation. Going in with a long-term mindset will help you weather short-term challenges and stay focused on your financial goals.

### Final Thoughts

Multifamily investing can be a rewarding path to financial independence, but first-time investors should take the time to educate themselves, build a strong team of advisors, and choose their property wisely. With the right preparation and support, your first multifamily investment can be the foundation of a successful real estate portfolio.

At **First Commercial Real Estate & Management**, we specialize in helping investors succeed at every stage — from pre-acquisition analysis and financing strategies to full-service property management and eventual sale. If you’re ready to take the next step in multifamily investing, **don’t go it alone — partner with experts who know how to maximize your returns and protect your investment.**

**Contact us today to schedule a consultation** and let’s build your multifamily investment future together.

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

The Value of Full-Cycle Multifamily Management: From Acquisition to Sale
------------------------------------------------------------------------

**August 4, 2025**

Investing in multifamily properties can be highly rewarding—but it’s also complex. From identifying the right asset to maximizing its performance and eventually exiting at the right time, each stage requires specialized expertise. Partnering with a company that manages the entire process—from pre-acquisition through management and eventual sale—offers significant advantages.

### 1\. **Smarter Acquisitions Through Market Insight**

A full-cycle firm doesn’t just find you a property; they analyze it with long-term success in mind. They bring data-driven insights into market trends, rent growth potential, and property performance, helping you avoid costly mistakes and select assets that align with your financial goals.

### 2\. **Seamless Transition Into Operations**

When the same team that helped you acquire the property also manages it, there’s no learning curve. They understand the investment thesis from day one, ensuring the management strategy aligns with your original vision—whether that means value-add renovations, operational efficiencies, or stabilized cash flow.

### 3\. **Optimized Property Performance**

A company with integrated services can actively monitor performance metrics and adjust strategies quickly. They’re incentivized to maximize net operating income because they know strong operations will lead to a stronger sale when the time comes.

### 4\. **Strategic Capital Improvements**

With a clear view of the entire lifecycle, these firms prioritize improvements that not only enhance day-to-day operations but also boost long-term asset value. This ensures every dollar spent is an investment in your eventual exit strategy.

### 5\. **Streamlined Exit Planning**

When it’s time to sell, a full-cycle company already knows the property inside and out. They can position it to attract the right buyers, provide accurate financials, and highlight value enhancements made during ownership—all of which can drive a higher sales price.

### 6\. **One Relationship, Complete Accountability**

Perhaps the greatest benefit is simplicity. Working with one partner for the entire lifecycle means fewer handoffs, less miscommunication, and one party fully accountable for the success of the investment from start to finish.

[Contact Us](mailto:management@first-commercial.com)

The Key to Resident Retention: Building Communities, Not Just Managing Properties
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**July 16, 2025**

In the multifamily housing industry, success isn’t just about filling units—it’s about keeping good residents happy, engaged, and wanting to stay year after year. At **First Commercial Multifamily Management**, we believe resident retention is the heartbeat of a healthy, thriving community.

Why does retention matter? It’s simple:  
✔️ Lower turnover means reduced vacancy costs and marketing expenses  
✔️ Long-term residents contribute to a stronger sense of community  
✔️ Happy residents are your best source of referrals

But keeping residents isn’t just about renewals—it’s about relationships.

Relationships Build Retention

Great resident experiences start with strong communication and a genuine commitment to service. Residents want to feel heard, valued, and part of a community—not just like a leaseholder on a spreadsheet.

**Here’s how we make that happen:**

*   **Prompt, Professional Service** – Quick response times for maintenance and clear communication create trust and satisfaction.
    
*   **Consistent Communication** – From newsletters to timely updates, staying connected helps residents feel informed and appreciated.
    
*   **Community Engagement** – Events, welcome gifts, or even small gestures can build a sense of belonging.
    
*   **Respectful Conflict Resolution** – Addressing concerns fairly and proactively shows residents that their well-being matters.
    

* * *

### 🛠️ Maintenance Matters

Nothing impacts resident satisfaction faster than unresolved maintenance issues. Responsive service requests and proactive maintenance are key drivers of retention—and a major reason why residents choose to renew.

state of the multifamily market: first half of 2025


-----------------------------------------------------

June 17, 2025

Demand > Supply = Rents rising! 

Q1 2025: absorption highest since ’85, vacancy at ~4.8%, investor interest surging. Landlord-friendly times ahead. Dive into the H1 multifamily trends:

### 1\. **Rising Demand Amid Slowing Supply**

*   Net absorption surged to approximately **100,600 units in Q1**, a 77% jump year-over-year, pushing vacancy rates down to **4.8%**, the lowest first-quarter level since 1985.
    
*   Meanwhile, **new deliveries slowed**: developers delivered around **116,000 units in Q1**, down 27% from Q3 2024 and 6.8% year-over-year.
    

### 2\. **Rent Growth Remains Steady**

*   Average asking rents rose by roughly **1.0% YoY**, reaching around **$1,761–$1,755** nationally by March–May across multifamily and single-family rental portfolios.
    
*   Smaller metro markets, especially the **Midwest and Northeast**, led rent gains—markets like NYC soared ~5.5–5.7%, Kansas City 4.0%, Columbus ~3.3%.
    

### 3\. **Investors Regain Confidence**

*   Multifamily investment activity picked up, with **$157 billion in sales over 12 months**, and Q1 2025 investment sales rose **9.7% over Q1 2024**, accounting for **36.1%** of total U.S. CRE volume.
    
*   CBRE found **75% of investors** expected to resume buying by H1 2025; **70% plan to buy more multifamily assets than last year.**
    

### 4\. **Build-to-Rent & Single-Family Rentals Strong**

*   Built-to-rent (BTR) sectors, particularly single-family rentals, remain robust with stable occupancy around **94.7%** and average rents near **$2,169–$2,183.**
    

### 5\. **Future Outlook: From Renter- to Landlord-Favorable**

*   With mortgage rates and home prices still high, renting continues to be appealing—housing cost differences are particularly stark for first-time buyers.
    
*   Development pipelines show signs of shrinking: multifamily starts have slowed 27%, and new deliveries are expected to drop further through 2026.
    
*   The combination of sluggish supply and sustained demand is poised to push **vacancy down further** and **rent growth upward**, making for a more **landlord-friendly market.**
    

* * *

### 📊 What This Means

| Summary | Implications |
| --- | --- |
| Demand > Supply | Tighter vacancy, pressure on rents |
| Investors returning | Increased competition, steady investment returns |
| Build-to-rent trends | Stability outside traditional multifamily sectors |
| Forecasted landlord-favorable shift | Landlords regain leverage; quicker rent growth |

* * *

### 💡 Final Takeaway

The first half of 2025 reveals a clear turnaround in the multifamily sector: **strong demand**, **stabilized supply**, and **growing investor confidence** are creating a robust, landlord-friendly environment. Markets showing population and job growth—especially Midwestern and gateway cities—are leading the charge. As development slows, multifamily fundamentals look poised for further strength into 2026.

If you’re a property manager, investor, or developer, now is the time to align your strategy with this evolving landscape—focus on high-absorption metros, track competing inventory closely, and prepare for rising rents.

Identity Theft in the multifamily industry: what you need to know


-------------------------------------------------------------------

June 5, 2025

**Identity theft isn’t just a personal issue—it’s a growing concern in the multifamily housing industry. From falsified rental applications to stolen mail and data breaches, apartment communities are increasingly vulnerable to fraudsters who exploit both digital and physical vulnerabilities.**

**Understanding how identity theft occurs in multifamily settings—and knowing how to respond—can help protect residents, management teams, and the integrity of your property.**

🕵️‍♂️ How Identity Theft Happens in Multifamily Communities

**1\. Fraudulent Rental Applications**  
Individuals may use stolen identities or forged documents to secure a lease. This can lead to skipped rent, criminal activity on-site, and legal complications for property managers.

**2\. Mail Theft**  
Communal mailboxes and unsecured package delivery areas can be easy targets for identity thieves looking for credit card statements, bank information, or pre-approved loan offers.

**3\. Data Breaches & Cybersecurity Lapses**  
Multifamily operators store sensitive information—like social security numbers, driver’s licenses, and financial records. If software systems aren’t secure or staff aren’t trained properly, this data can be vulnerable.

**4\. Phishing & Social Engineering**  
Residents and staff may unknowingly fall victim to scams that trick them into revealing personal information via phone, email, or even in-person deception.

* * *

### 🛠️ Steps Management Can Take

**1\. Strengthen Application Screening**

*   Use a reputable tenant screening service.
    
*   Cross-check documentation and verify employment and rental history thoroughly.
    
*   Be cautious of inconsistencies in IDs or incomplete applications.
    

**2\. Secure Mail & Packages**

*   Encourage residents to pick up mail promptly.
    
*   Install secure, lockable mailboxes and package lockers.
    
*   Work with postal carriers or delivery services to limit unattended drop-offs.
    

**3\. Invest in Data Protection**

*   Use encrypted property management software.
    
*   Regularly update passwords and software systems.
    
*   Limit access to sensitive data based on employee roles.
    

**4\. Educate Your Team & Residents**

*   Train staff to spot suspicious behavior or documents.
    
*   Send regular reminders to residents about mail theft, phishing scams, and online safety.
    
*   Provide resources on reporting fraud and protecting personal information.
    

* * *

### 👮 What To Do If Identity Theft Is Suspected

If identity theft is suspected on your property:

1.  **Document the incident** – gather all relevant information and evidence.
    
2.  **Alert authorities** – contact local law enforcement and, if needed, the U.S. Postal Inspection Service.
    
3.  **Notify affected parties** – including residents, vendors, or staff who may be impacted.
    
4.  **Audit your systems** – assess any potential weaknesses and take corrective action.
    
5.  **Cooperate with investigations** – provide support to police or legal teams as needed.
    

* * *

### 🧾 Resources to Share With Residents

*   [www.identitytheft.gov](https://www.identitytheft.gov/)
     – Federal Trade Commission’s recovery plan
    
*   Credit bureaus (Experian, TransUnion, Equifax) for fraud alerts
    
*   Local police departments and post offices
    

* * *

### Final Thought

Identity theft in the multifamily industry is a serious issue that requires proactive management, education, and technology. By securing your systems, staying vigilant, and promoting awareness within your community, you can reduce the risk and protect your residents’ peace of mind.

Let’s stay informed, alert, and committed to a safer rental experience for everyone.

Why Renters Insurance Is One of the Smartest Decisions You Can Make


---------------------------------------------------------------------

May 29, 2025

Many renters believe their landlord’s insurance policy will cover them in case of fire, theft, or damage. Unfortunately, that’s not the case. A landlord’s policy typically only covers the building itself—not your personal belongings, liability, or temporary living expenses if disaster strikes.

That’s where **renters insurance** comes in.

### 🏠 What Is Renters Insurance?

Renters insurance is a policy that protects your personal property and offers liability coverage while you’re renting a home or apartment. For a small monthly premium—usually between $10 and $25—you gain peace of mind and financial protection.

* * *

### 🔒 What Does It Cover?

Most standard policies include:

**1\. Personal Property Protection**  
If your belongings are damaged or stolen due to events like fire, theft, vandalism, or certain types of water damage, renters insurance helps you replace them.

**2\. Liability Coverage**  
If someone is injured in your unit or you accidentally damage another person’s property (like a leak that damages your neighbor’s ceiling), this coverage can help pay for legal and medical costs.

**3\. Additional Living Expenses (ALE)**  
If your apartment becomes uninhabitable due to a covered event, your policy may pay for hotel stays, food, and other costs while you’re temporarily displaced.

* * *

### 💸 Why It’s Worth Every Penny

**It’s affordable** – For less than the cost of a streaming subscription, you can protect thousands of dollars’ worth of personal property.

**It can save you from major out-of-pocket expenses** – Without coverage, you’d have to replace everything you own on your own, not to mention pay for alternative housing in an emergency.

**It helps protect your future** – Having renters insurance and filing claims responsibly can positively affect your insurance history, potentially lowering premiums for future homeowners or auto policies.

* * *

### 🧾 Renters Insurance & Your Lease

Some apartment communities require renters insurance as part of the lease agreement, and for good reason: it helps protect both you and the property. Even if it’s not mandatory, it’s still highly recommended as part of being a responsible resident.

* * *

### ✅ How to Get Started

*   Shop around: Compare quotes from reputable providers.
    
*   Know what you need: Take an inventory of your belongings.
    
*   Understand your policy: Make sure it covers the types of risks most likely to affect you (like floods, if you’re in a flood-prone area).
    

* * *

### Final Thought

Accidents and disasters are unpredictable—but your financial well-being doesn’t have to be. Renters insurance is a small investment with big benefits. Whether you’re in a studio apartment or a three-bedroom rental, it’s one of the easiest ways to protect yourself, your belongings, and your peace of mind.

Storm & Severe Weather Safety: A Guide for Apartment Living


---------------------------------------------------------------

May 19, 2025

Whether it’s tornado season in Oklahoma, heavy thunderstorms, or unexpected winter storms, it’s crucial to be prepared—and to know what actions to take when weather turns dangerous.

Here’s how apartment residents can stay safe and informed when storms strike:

### 🌪️ **1\. Know Your Risks**

Tulsa and many areas in Oklahoma are prone to:

*   Tornadoes and straight-line winds
    
*   Severe thunderstorms with hail and lightning
    
*   Flash flooding
    
*   Power outages
    

Check local emergency management websites or apps like FEMA, Red Cross, or your local news station for area-specific alerts.

* * *

### 📲 **2\. Sign Up for Weather Alerts**

Make sure you’re receiving emergency alerts. Here’s how:

*   Enable Wireless Emergency Alerts (WEAs) on your smartphone.
    
*   Download a reliable weather app (such as NOAA Weather Radar or WeatherBug).
    
*   Follow your city’s emergency management on social media for updates.
    

* * *

### 🧰 **3\. Prepare a Basic Emergency Kit**

Even in an apartment, you can keep a compact emergency kit ready:

*   Flashlight & extra batteries
    
*   First aid kit
    
*   Bottled water (1 gallon per person per day, at least 3 days)
    
*   Non-perishable snacks
    
*   Medications and essential documents
    
*   Phone charger & power bank
    
*   Whistle (in case of rescue needs)
    
*   Extra face masks and hand sanitizer
    

Store your kit in a location that’s easy to grab in a hurry.

* * *

### 🧭 **4\. Know Where to Shelter**

In an apartment:

*   **Ground floor units** or **interior bathrooms** are usually safest.
    
*   Avoid windows and exterior walls.
    
*   If your building has a designated storm shelter or safe room, **know where it is ahead of time**.
    
*   Live on a higher floor? Ask management if there is a safer area in the building to relocate during storms.
    

* * *

### 🔌 **5\. Before the Storm Hits**

*   Charge your phone and devices.
    
*   Bring pets indoors and gather their supplies.
    
*   Move patio furniture or loose items from balconies to prevent them from becoming projectiles.
    
*   Fill the bathtub with water for non-drinking use if flooding or water supply issues are possible.
    

* * *

### 💡 **6\. During the Storm**

*   Stay indoors and away from windows.
    
*   Monitor the situation with a weather radio or app.
    
*   Avoid elevators, especially during tornado watches or power outage threats.
    
*   If flooding begins, move to higher ground _safely_ and avoid walking through water.
    

* * *

### 🛠️ **7\. After the Storm**

*   Wait for official confirmation that it’s safe to leave your shelter.
    
*   Report damage or hazards (like gas smells or downed lines) to your property manager immediately.
    
*   Be cautious of debris, broken glass, and slick areas in common spaces.
    
*   Take photos of any damage to your belongings for insurance purposes.
    

* * *

### Severe weather can happen quickly, but with preparation and awareness, you can weather the storm safely—even from your apartment. Talk with us about building-specific safety plans, and consider sharing this information with neighbors to help foster a safe and informed community.

Stay safe, stay ready—and don’t wait until the storm sirens sound to make your plan.

**Understanding fair housing law: what every property owner needs to know**


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

April 9, 2025

The **Fair Housing Act**, originally passed in 1968 and amended over the years, prohibits discrimination in the sale, rental, and financing of housing based on: 

*   Race
*   Color
*   National Origin
*   Religion

*   Sex
*   Familial Status
*   Disability

Some states and municipalities may include additional protections, such as source of income, age, or military status, so it’s important to be familiar with both **federal and local laws**.

### **Why It Matters for Property Owners**

Violating Fair Housing Laws can result in **costly lawsuits**, **fines**, and **damage to your reputation**. Even unintentional discrimination—such as writing a rental ad that includes phrasing like “perfect for singles”—can be considered a violation. It’s your responsibility as a landlord or property manager to treat all prospective and current tenants equally and fairly.

### **Best Practices for Compliance**

To stay in compliance and foster an inclusive rental environment, follow these guidelines:

#### 1\. **Standardize Your Screening Process**

Use the same criteria for all applicants, such as income-to-rent ratio, credit score, background checks, and rental history. Avoid subjective language like “gut feeling.”

#### 2\. **Be Careful with Advertising**

Your rental listings should focus on the property, not the type of tenant you’re looking for. Avoid phrases that suggest preference, such as “ideal for young couples” or “no kids.”

#### 3\. **Provide Reasonable Accommodations**

If a tenant has a disability, be prepared to make reasonable modifications or accommodations, such as allowing a service animal even if you have a no-pets policy.

#### 4\. **Train Your Staff**

If you work with a team, make sure everyone involved in leasing or property management is trained on Fair Housing Laws and understands how to avoid discrimination—intentional or not.

#### 5\. **Document Everything**

Keep written records of interactions with applicants and tenants, especially decisions about applications or lease terminations. Clear documentation can help protect you if questions arise.

### **Work With Professionals**

Partnering with a knowledgeable property management company like First Commercial can make a big difference in maintaining compliance. We stay up to date on changing laws and can help you navigate complex situations with confidence.

data.markdown: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Buyer Broker Client Contracts 8301 E 74 th PL, Tulsa Oklahoma 74133 P: (918) 495-1551 F:(918) 491- 1742 This is a legally binding contract; if not understood seek advice from an attorney. BROKERAGE SERVICES AGREEMENT Broker: First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation (“Broker”) Buyer: Buyer’s Address: 1. PURPOSE. Buyer desires to engage the services of First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation specifically to assist Buyer in purchasing Multifamily real estate, as more particularly described in Paragraph 2. Broker’s services shall include, but not be limited to, consulting with Buyer regarding particular properties and the availability of financing; formulating acquisition strategies and purchase agreements and receiving delivery of any offers made by Buyer and accepted by Seller. 2. First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation understands and acknowledges that the Buyer is requesting the assistance of First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation to act as the Buyer’s Exclusive Representative for the purposes of Multifamily property only and shall receive compensation on each and every transaction as a result of this agreement for as long as this agreement remains in effect. 3. PROPERTY. Buyer desires to purchase multifamily property in the following States: 4. BROKER. Buyer agrees that during the term of this Agreement any and all inquiries and/or negotiations relating to the acquisition by Buyer of any Multifamily Property in the area(s) referenced above, shall be through First Commercial. 5. TERM/CANCELLATION. This Agreement shall be enforced for twelve (12) months following the date of acceptance hereof. This Agreement may be canceled by either of the parties with five days’ written notice to the President/Principal Broker identified herein and this contract shall be cancelled immediately upon receipt by the President/Principal Broker or upon expiration if not renewed. Upon cancellation of this Agreement, the Client agrees that the Broker shall be compensated for the Clients’ acquisition of any properties which have been exposed to the Client during the active term of this Agreement by email, printed form, Brokers website or any other form for a 90-day period after said cancellation. Buyers obligations under paragraph five (5) herein shall survive such termination. 6. COMPENSATION OF BROKER. Buyer and Broker agree that Broker shall seek payment of all Brokerage fees from the proceeds of the transaction. The Commission is due and payable upon Closing. The Commission shall apply to any purchase agreements executed during the term of this Agreement, or during any extension of this Agreement. The Commission will also apply to purchase agreements executed within ninety (90) days after the expiration or other termination of this Agreement if the property acquired was presented to Buyer through the services of Broker. \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Buyer Broker 7. DISCLOSURE OF BROKER’S ROLE. Broker’s relationship with Buyer and duties under that relationship as provided under the Broker Relationship Act are as follows: A. A Broker shall enter into a written brokerage agreement prior to providing services as a Buyer’s Broker. B. The BROKER shall provide BUYER BROKERAGE services to Buyer as provided under the Broker Relationship Act and shall have the duties and responsibilities identified in Exhibit A attached hereto: At the time of any initial contract, Broker shall inform all prospective Sellers and their Brokers, of the relationship Broker has with Buyer and that Broker shall be paid from the transaction. In the event Broker has previously worked with a Seller of a particular piece of property, Broker will preserve any confidential information obtained during that prior brokerage relationship and will not use such confidential information to the detriment of the Seller. Buyer acknowledges and agrees that the preservation of this confidential information shall not constitute a breach of any duty owed by Broker to Buyer. 8. OTHER POTENTIAL BUYERS. Buyer understands that other potential buyers may consider, make offers on, or purchase through First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation the same or similar properties as Buyer seeks to acquire. Buyer consents to First Commercial’s relationship with such potential buyers before, during and after the expiration of the Agreement. In no event shall a Frist Commercial Broker, Broker Associate or Associate represent multiple Clients on the same property at the same time. Should two or more Clients of a Broker wish to make offers on the same property, the Broker shall reassign all but one to other First Commercial Brokers for representation on the specific property. Broker shall not, however, disclose to buyer the material terms of any pending offer for the purchase of said property nor shall Broker reveal or discuss with other of its buyers the material terms of any offer made by Buyer hereunder while said offer is in effect. 9. COST OF SERVICES OR PRODUCTS OBTAINED FROM OUTSIDE SOURCES. Broker will NOT obtain or order products or services from outside sources (e.g. surveys, soil tests, title reports, and inspections). It is Buyer’s sole responsibility to obtain any such reports. Buyer agrees to pay all costs for products or services so obtained. 10. INDEMNIFICIATION OF BROKER. Buyer agrees to indemnify Broker and to hold Broker harmless on account of any and all costs or damages arising out of this Agreement, provided Broker is not at fault, including, but not limited to attorney’s fees reasonably incurred by Broker. 11. NON-DISCRIMINATION. It is agreed by Broker and Buyer, parties to this Agreement, that as required by law, discrimination based on religion, race, color, national origin, age, sex, handicap, or familial status, by said parties in respect to the purchase of the Desired Property is prohibited. 12. CONDITION OF PROPERTY. Buyer is not relying on Broker to determine the suitability of any Multifamily Property for the Buyer’s purposes. Broker shall not be obligated to discover latent defects in the Multifamily Property or to advise on matters outside of the scope of his/her real estate license. Broker hereby advises Buyer to seek legal, tax and other professional advice relating to any proposed real estate transaction. Broker does not make any representation or warranty with respect to the advisability of, or the legal effect of, any transaction contemplated by Buyer and shall cooperate fully with any legal counsel of Buyer’s choice. Broker is not an expert in matters relating to law, tax, financing, surveying, structural condition, hazardous materials, engineering, environmental risk, or any other highly specialized areas. Buyer is encouraged to seek expert assistance in these areas. 13. ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties, and any prior agreements, whether oral or written, have been merged and integrated into this Agreement. \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ \_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Buyer Broker 14. SPECIAL CONDITIONS. The Buyer herein agrees that all properties obtained from the Broker’s private website shall be included as “Shown Properties” under this Agreement. 15. RECEIPT. Buyer has read this Agreement and acknowledges receipt of a completed copy of this Agreement. BUYER HEREBY APPOINTS AND AUTHORIZES BROKER TO RECEIVE DELIVERY OF WRITTEN CONTRACTS ON BEHALF OF THE BUYER. This Agreement made and executed this \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ day of \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_, \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Broker: First Commercial Real Estate Services Corporation \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ By \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ By \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Phone: (918) 495 – 1551 Fax: (918) 495 – 1742 Email: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ This Agreement made and executed this \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ day of \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_, \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Buyer: \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ By \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ By \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ Phone: Email: Referring Associate License Number License State Referring Company License Number License State Phone Fax Email
